definitions.definition: the official who controls the game in some sports

examples.text: He was sent off for arguing with the referee.
The referee awarded a free kick to the home team.
The referee booked three players for offensive behaviour.
an assistant referee flagged for a penalty
decisions taken by the match referee
my 20 years as a professional referee
Graham is a qualified football referee.
The referee blew his whistle and called the foul.

definitions.definition: a person who gives information about your character and ability, usually in a letter, for example when you are applying for a job

examples.text: The principal often acts as a referee for his students.
His former employer agreed to act as a referee for him.

definitions.definition: a person who is asked to settle an argument

examples.text: to act as a referee between the parties involved

definitions.definition: a person who reads and checks the quality of an academic article before it is published

examples.text: All papers are sent out to external referees.
